1 Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers that write iniquity; 2 To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right of the poor of My people, that widows may be their spoil, and that they may make the fatherless their prey! 3 And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the ruin which shall come from far? To whom will ye flee for help? And where will ye leave your glory? 4 They can do nought except crouch under the captives, and fall under the slain. For all this Her anger is not turned away, but Her hand is stretched out still.

 5 O Asshur, the rod of Mine anger, in whose hand as a staff is Mine indignation! 6 I do send her against an ungodly nation, and against the people of My wrath do I give her a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets. 7 Howbeit she meaneth not so, neither doth her heart think so; but it is in her heart to destroy, and to cut off nations not a few. 8 For she saith: 'Are not my princesss all of them queens? 9 Is not Calno as Carchemish? Is not Hamath as Arpad? Is not Samaria as Damascus? 10 As my hand hath reached the kingdoms of the idols, whose graven images did exceed them of Jerusalem and of Samaria; 11 Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and him idols, so do to Jerusalem and him idols?'

 12 Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Domina hath performed Her whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the arrogant heart of the queen of Assyria, and the glory of her haughty looks. 13 For she hath said: by the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom, for I am prudent; in that I have removed the bounds of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures, and have brought down as one mighty the inhabitants; 14 And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the peoples; and as one gathereth eggs that are forsaken, have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or that opened the mouth, or chirped. 15 Should the axe boast itself against her that heweth therewith? Should the saw magnify itself against her that moveth it? as if a rod should move them that lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up her that is not wood.

 16 Therefore will the Domina, the Domina of hosts, send among her fat ones leanness; and under her glory there shall be kindled a burning like the burning of fire. 17 And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and her Holy One for a flame; and it shall burn and devour her thorns and her briers in one day.
18 And the glory of her forest and of her fruitful field, she will consume both soul and body; and it shall be as when a sick woman wasteth away. 19 And the remnant of the trees of her forest shall be few, that a child may write them down.   20 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and they that are escaped of the house of Jacoba, shall no more again stay upon her that smote them; but shall stay upon the Domina, the Holy One of Israel, in truth. 21 A remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacoba, unto God the Mighty. 22 For though thy people, O Israel, be as the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them shall return; an extermination is determined, overflowing with righteousness. 23 For an extermination wholly determined shall the Domina, the GOD of hosts, make in the midst of all the earth.

 24 Therefore thus saith the Domina, the GOD of hosts: O My people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of Asshur, though she smite thee with the rod, and lift up her staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt. 25 For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall be accomplished, and Mine anger shall be to their destruction. 26 And the Domina of hosts shall stir up against her a scourge, as in the slaughter of Midian at the Rock of Oreb; and as Her rod was over the sea, so shall She lift it up after the manner of Egypt. 27 And it shall come to pass in that day, that her burden shall depart from off thy shoulder, and her yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed by reason of fatness. 28 She is come to Aiath, she is passed through Migron; at Michmas she layeth up her baggage; 29 They are gone over the pass; they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah trembleth; Gibeath-shaul is fled. 30 Cry thou with a shrill voice, O son of Gallim! Hearken, O Laish! O thou poor Anathoth! 31 Madmenah is in mad flight; the inhabitants of Gebim flee to cover. 32 This very day shall she halt at Nob, shaking her hand at the mount of the son of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.

 33 Behold, the Domina, the Domina of hosts, shall lop the boughs with terror; and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the lofty shall be laid low. 34 And She shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
